annotation.spannedText: Gottlieb is the ultimate pharma shill, if such a thing exists

annotation.spannedText: She does not appear to be the sort of person who would be willing to help Trump dismantle the public health system by supporting the idea that vaccines cause autism, supporting dismantling the Vaccine Court, or calling for more bogus antivaccine “research” designed to find nonexistent detrimental health effects due to vaccines

annotation.spannedText: She’s quite pro-vaccine

annotation.spannedText: These are not the sort of things that someone who is antivaccine or antivaccine-sympathetic write

annotation.spannedText: Nor would an antivaccine or antivaccine-sympathetic person allow a blog that promotes vaccination, including entries promoting the birth dose of the hepatitis B vaccine, tells parents how to catch their children up on their shots if they fall behind, and urges pregnant women to get their Tdap vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Nor do people who are antivaccine or antivaccine-sympathetic willingly enforce laws in which only nonmedical exemptions or religious exemptions are permitted, with a notarized state-issued form being the only accepted way of claiming a religious exemption

annotation.spannedText: anyone who is involved in public health, especially at a leadership level (particularly at a state leadership level) is pro-vaccine

annotation.spannedText: It has to do with science and the fact that vaccines work

annotation.spannedText: They are the single most effective public health intervention conceived by the human mind and made by human hands

annotation.spannedText: They do not cause autism

annotation.spannedText: They do not cause all the horrible autoimmune and other diseases that antivaxers claim

annotation.spannedText: They save lives, lots of lives

annotation.spannedText: Sooner or later, anyone in public health who is intellectually honest, regardless of ideological bent, be it liberal or conservative, comes to that conclusion
